raw_response: {"answer_index": 3, "answer_text": "Urethral hemangioma", "confidence": 8, "reasoning": "The most common cause of blood-stained diaper in a neonate is usually a benign lesion such as a urethral hemangioma. Sickle cell trait is not a common cause of hematuria in neonates, and bilharziasis is not seen in neonates. Meatal stenosis is also not a typical cause in this age group. Urethral hemangioma is a recognized cause of painless hematuria in neonates.", "evidence_quality": "normal"}
